info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 7:59PM EDT until August 11 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Jenkins.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Radar data estimates that rainfall rates of around 2 inches per hour are impacting the western portion of Jenkins County. Some roadway flooding will be possible, and could impact roads such as Lewis Church Road, W Old Savannah Road, Highway 17, and Birdsville Road. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millen, Butts, Emmalane, Herndon, Perkins, Rogers, Birdsville, Lawton and Thrift.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING
